message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.CR 

This paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it addresses the problem of person re-identification, which is a common task in computer vision. The paper also proposes a metric learning framework using Kernel Fisher Discriminant Analysis (KFDA), which is a popular technique in computer vision and machine learning. 

The paper also involves learning a discriminative metric space, which is a task commonly studied in machine learning (cs.LG). 

The use of multiple kernel learning methods to enhance the efficiency of KFDA is also relevant to multimedia (cs.MM) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories, as these fields often involve the processing and analysis of large amounts of data. 

Finally, the paper may also be relevant to the cryptography and security (cs.CR) sub-category, as person re-identification is often used in security applications such as surveillance and access control.
